revised_title: The Presence of Contractile Vacuoles in Sponge Cells
tldr: The authors investigated the presence of contractile vacuoles in sponge cells, specifically in freshwater and marine sponges. They found contractile vacuoles in both amoebocytes and choanocytes of freshwater sponges, but not in cells of some marine sponges. The study provides important observations for understanding the relationships of Porifera to Protozoa and Metazoa.
